tool.name: Consensus.seqs
tool.description: Find a consensus sequence for each OTU or phylotype
tool.command:
echo 'consensus.seqs( fasta=$fasta #if $name: ,name=$name #end if #if $cutoff: ,cutoff=$cutoff #end if #if $perotu.use == "yes": ,list=$perotu.otu #if $perotu.label: ,label=${ str($perotu.label).replace(",","-") } #end if #end if #if $count: ,count=$count #end if )' | sed 's/ //g' ## mothur trips over whitespace | mothur &&
## move output files to correct destination prefix='$fasta' && #if $perotu.use == 'yes': mv \${prefix%.dat}*.cons.* . && #else mv \${prefix%.dat}*.cons.summary '$summary' && mv \${prefix%.dat}*.cons.fasta '$cons_fasta' && #end if mv mothur.*.logfile '$logfile'

param.name: use
param.label: Consensus sequence
param.option: Consensus sequence for each OTU in list

param.name: label
param.label: label - Select OTU Labels
param.help: By default all labels are used

param.name: cutoff
param.label: Cutoff - set a percentage of sequences that support the base
param.help: For example: cutoff=95 would return the base that was supported by at least 95% of sequences. Must be between 1 and 100. Optional

param.name: count
param.label: Count - a count table
param.help: this file can be generated by count.seqs

collection.name: consensusfastas
collection.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: consensus fasta files per OTU

collection.name: consensusnames
collection.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: consensus names files per OTU

collection.name: consensussummaries
collection.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: consensus summary files per OTU

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The consensus.seqs_ command can be used in 2 ways: create a consensus sequence from a fastafile, or with a listfile create a consensus sequence for each otu. Sequences must be aligned.
.. _consensus.seqs: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Consensus.seqs
